transcripts.text: This was Jerry Nadler, you know, who's an angry, evil guy, the penguin, whatever you want to call him.  He's awful.  He said that Antifa violence was a myth earlier.  The amount of sound bites and things that we can play from Jerry Nadler over his long and unsuccessful career is a ton.  But this was, I don't know if you saw this.  Something's off with Nadler.  We knew that, but something is now really off with him.  This was a scene yesterday, roll seven.  He's leaving the podium, sort of.

As I bring on Congresswoman Maloney, I want to join the Distinguished Chairman in acknowledging legislation of other members of Congress that are contained in the Chairman's legislation that they are putting forth and Chairwoman's.  And I also want to acknowledge Maxine Waters is doing some very important work on this subject, not part of this package, but part of preserving our our democracy.  with that i'm pleased to yield to the same.

so i look i i always say this and i mean it from the bottom of my heart with with joe biden and what i'm about to say with jerry too.  i don't wish ill upon any of these people.  i think they're awful.  i don't think they understand us.  i think that they're leading us down a treacherous dangerous path But I don't wish ill on them.  If you do, then that's between you and God.  That's between you and whoever else.  But I just don't.  But something is clearly wrong there, right?  The two options that I see are either he crapped his pants.  He slowed up a lot there, and then he kind of waddled off.  So there could be a fecal disaster going on.  Or he had some sort of stroke or something else happening, which, again, I don't wish that upon him.  But something's wrong there.  And between the gaffes that we see on a daily basis and the one we just played from Biden, which was a little bit earlier this year, what just happened there with Nadler, what we see from Pelosi all the time, what we see from all these people, folks – These people are prominent leaders in our country.  We can't have that.  We can't have people who are unfit.  We shouldn't be voting in ones with radical ideas and philosophies and or people like Joe who have since caved to radical people and philosophies.  And we can't have people who can't even get off of a damn podium, whether it's because he pooped his pants or because he has a health issue.  I don't care.  You need to be able to do your job.  And you need to be able to do it in a way that inspires confidence from the people.  And I'm just not seeing that.  I'm not seeing it in so many people.  You see it from Maxine.  You see it from Feinstein.  You've seen it now from Nadler.  You see it from Pelosi all the time.  Whether she seems like she's having an health issue or she's drunk, whatever the case might be, it's time that we do better.  We have to be better with who's serving.  But, you know, Nadler, Pelosi, all these names I just rattled off, they've been in government forever.  I mean, we're talking forever.  Nancy's in her 17th term.  17th term.  And this was her yesterday talking about impeachment.

The idea of the peaceful transfer of power is, well, it's no surprise, again, because the president has been contemptible of science and governance.  And so you see 200,000 people have died.  But I have confidence in the American people.  And I have confidence that he won't get away with saying, for example, I won with the popular, the vote on the ground, the vote in the mail doesn't count and the rest of that.  What am I missing here about people just not saying, hold it, calm down, Mr.  President?  Now, we do know who he admires.  He admires Putin.  He admires Kim Jong-un.  He admires Erdogan in Turkey.  He admires people who are perpetuating their roles in government.  But he reminds him, you are not in North Korea.  You are not in Turkey.  You are not in Russia, Mr.  President.  And by the way, you are not in Saudi Arabia.  You are in the United States of America.  It is a democracy.  So why don't you just try for a moment to honor your oath of office to the Constitution of the United States?
Madam Speaker.  Yes, I have confidence in it.

It would not be a good thing for our country, for our election to be ignored by the President so that a solution as the Constitution provides for, but nonetheless one that does not, in my view, constitute a peaceful transfer of power.

Along those same lines, President Trump has made past provocative statements, and you guys have been up here at the podiums and said there were horrible things to say and then gone about the business.  Is there anything more formal that you want to do to make your opposition to what he said yesterday known?  since your resolution, you took up a resolution after Charlottesville?

I don't think he's worth the trouble at this point.  We have 40 days until the election.  He is trying to discredit mail-in voting, but he's hurting.  As you've heard some of the Republicans say, this has been an important part of our electoral success, mail-in voting.  He's he's discrediting that.

All right.  So he's not discrediting it again.  You're you're lying to cover for what you're trying to do with mail in voting.  But you heard her say there.  The main thing was there was some lead up kind of letting her set the stage with answering the question, the previous question.  But then she was asked about impeachment.  And she said he's not worth it.  There's 40 days left.  She's not worth it or he's not worth it.  Excuse me.  So at least for now, we've got a 40-day reprieve where maybe that won't be talked about.  And she's pushing hard on, you know what, let's just vote.  We've got 40 days.  Let's just vote.  Let's do just vote, folks.  Let's get out there and dominate on Election Day because I think we can.  I think they've set themselves up for that.  I think going down – I think they know that going down – she doesn't actually think he's not worth it.  She just feels like she gets stymied everywhere she goes, everything she does.  Trump shoves it right back in their face and they look like fools.  And they don't want to look like fools again so close to the election.  Do I think that impeachment could happen again once he wins?  Yeah, of course.  There's going to be all sorts of crap that happens after a Trump victory, which I do think is going to happen.  I might be wrong, but I do think it's going to happen.

A portion of each purchase donated to veteran and first responder charities.  Initial subscription purchase is matched bar for bar and sent overseas to deploy troops.  Let freedom clean.  Hero Soap Company.
